page.title: 10MILLBROOK RESVR,WATERWKS VAL
page.content: Many valleys in Jersey are used for storing drinking water for the people of the island. Some of the first reservoirs to be built are to be found in {Waterworks Valley}on the border of {St.Lawrence.}The valley itself is particularly beautiful because of the many different deciduous trees to be found there. {Millbrook Reservoir}was completed in 1899 and was originally designed to to store 12 million gallons of water. It receives its water from the streams of {St.Lawrence}and also from a small pumping station in{Bellozanne Valley.} After filtration and sterilization the stored water is pumped to the { {Westmount Service Reservoir}and from there to the customer. Until 1932 Millbrook was the only treatment plant in Jersey.
